itemDescription: only son of the Duke and Duchess of Gloucester

wikipedia_page.main:
Alexander Patrick Gregers Richard Windsor, Earl of Ulster (born 24 October 1974) is a former British Army officer and the only son of Prince Richard, Duke of Gloucester, and Birgitte, Duchess of Gloucester.
As heir apparent to the dukedom of Gloucester, he is accorded the courtesy title Earl of Ulster, but is commonly known as Alex Ulster.

link_mentions.page: Alexander Patrick Gregers Richard Windsor, Earl of Ulster

response: The title of Earl of Ulster has been created six times in the Peerage of Ireland and twice in the Peerage of the United Kingdom. Since 1928, the title has been held by the Duke of Gloucester and is used as a courtesy title by the Duke's eldest son, currently Alexander Windsor, Earl of Ulster. The wife of the Earl of Ulster is known as the Countess of Ulster. Ulster, one of the four traditional provinces of Ireland, consists of nine counties: six of these make up Northern Ireland; the remainder are in the Irish Republic.
*Lady Cosima Windsor, born 2010, daughter of Alexander Windsor, Earl of Ulster and 29th in line of succession to the British throne.
*Alexander Windsor, Earl of Ulster (born 1974) son of the Duke and Duchess of Gloucester
